Articles.Content:
KSP Version: Version 0.90.0 Beta

Problem: When flying a specific rocket build, at about 6000-7000 meters, it will spontaneously combust (and by that I just mean explode). The top stages are still perfectly intact, but useless as I am assuming I have enough fuel in the first stage to get into space. The output log simply says "structural failure" between parts, but these are parts that have no reason to fail. The ship has a slight tilt that will flip it if not using ASAS, but I don't think this has anything to do with the bug.

Save File: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/jeww4qbz13gfgns/AADBVPaQ3NmTjrXC_KJH3Ytea?dl=0

Craft File: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ld08jueyd5rzd09/Satellite.craft?dl=0

Output Log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/gi3buch9on1yvq0/output_log.txt?dl=0

Processor Intel® Core i5-3337U CPU @ 1.80GHz

Drive

Size 909.8 GB

Free 648.6 GB
You're getting a lot of NullReferenceErrors, and I haven't heard of others getting this error. Does it happen with other crafts? And are you 110% sure you don't have any outdated mods installed?

I don't have any mods installed, and have not installed mods since months ago when I transferred my license to steam.

Guess I'll try a clean reinstall and hope that fixes it!

And no, it doesn't happen with other crafts. Just something about this design, for whatever reason.

Edited December 17, 2014 by mr.millian
